intro: Metrosideros glomulifera, commonly known as the silver-leaf pohutukawa, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a small evergreen tree or shrub that typically grows in coastal areas, characterized by its silver-gray foliage. The plant produces showy, red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as birds and insects. Its leaves are thick and leathery, adapted to withstand coastal salt spray and strong winds. The species is part of the Myrtaceae family, which includes other notable plants like eucalyptus and tea trees.
